column4: guys i have a gnome terminal question.. how can i set its transparency to look at the windows behind it?
you need a compositing window manager like compiz (or fake one with xcompmgr)
means? coz maybe that is my problem.. when i set the transparency though profile.. i see my wallpaper.. escott, yes its fake one..

the more interesting question is which ubuntu version. the (older) standard ubuntu windowmanager metacity doesn not do real alpha-channel transparency. either you need to use compiz (that thing with the cool 3D cube) or install xcompmgr (a command line program) and run it.
